items.title: About Moments iQ
items.body:
Moments iQ is in Early Access and is only available to select customers. If you are interested in trying this feature, contact your Tealium Support representative.

Requirements

If you plan to integrate Moments iQ with server-side products, you will need the following:

  • Tealium AudienceStream or Tealium EventStream.
  • Data Layer Enrichment enabled.
  • The most recent version of the Tealium Collect tag.

How it works

Moments iQ allows you to create an experience on your website that collects preferences and sentiments (aka zero-party data) in real-time directly from your visitors. With this data, you can better understand what your visitors want and how they want to be seen by your brand, without the need for additional tools. You can create more robust audiences, which lead to deeper and more meaningful customer relationships that you can use to further personalize the visitor experience or engage with them through connectors.

Zero-party data is information that you collect directly from a customer. You can ask them specific questions about their preferences, purchase intentions, or recent shopping experiences. Zero-party data is declarative, while first-party data in inferred from visitor activity, such as their browsing activity on your site and their purchases.

An experience example:

Features

Moments iQ provides the following features:

  • Multiple question formats
    Customize the question that will guide the visitor to the right experience on your site.
  • Custom style and appearance
    Match the look and feel of your site to provide your visitors with a seamless experience. You can also position the experience anywhere on a page or you can pop up the experience in a styled modal window.
  • Target with rules and events
    Set the conditions to determine whether the experience appears on a page or the visitor behavior that triggers the appearance of the experience.
  • Privacy by design
    Data is collected, processed, and stored appropriately based on your profile configuration.
  • Seamless integration
    Send the event data to AudienceStream to enhance visitor profiles, assign badges, or update audience membership to trigger connectors.
  • Real-time data collection
    Instantly update the visitor’s profile for immediate personalization and a better user experience.

Moments iQ configuration is bundled with your existing installation of our JavaScript library (utag.js). No additional code on your site is necessary.

Steps

Moments iQ is set up through the following screens in the Moments iQ tag:

  • Tag configuration: Configure the tag’s position and appearance on the page.
  • Load rules and event listeners: Set the conditions to determine whether the experience appears on a page or the visitor behavior that triggers the appearance of the experience.
  • Data mapping: Set overrides for configuration options.

Events

When the visitor submits or closes the experience, the browser sends a utag.track call with the relevant data for your tags and extensions to process.

Moments iQ events use the following variables:

VariableTypeDescriptionExample
tealium_eventStringThe event will contain one of the following values:
  • momentsiq_close: If the visitor closed the window, usually with the close button.
  • momentsiq_submit: If the visitor clicked the primary button, whether they answered the question or not.
momentsiq_close
momentsiq_question1StringThe name of the question that the visitor answered. If they did not answer a question, this variable is blank.What is your favorite color?
momentsiq_question1_typeStringIf the visitor clicked the primary button, the type of question (checkbox, text, or radio)radio
momentsiq_idNumberThe tag UID.34
momentsiq_answer1StringIf the visitor clicked the primary button, the answer or answers that the visitor entered or selected. Multiple answers are separated by the pipe (|) character.Red

Examples

This is the event for a radio button experience with a submitted answer:

{  "tealium_event": "momentsiq_submit",  "momentsiq_id": "54",  "momentsiq_question1_type": "radio",  "momentsiq_question1": "What is your favorite color?",  "momentsiq_answer1": "Blue"}

This is the event for a checkbox experience with multiple answers submitted:

{  "tealium_event": "momentsiq_submit",  "momentsiq_id": "55",  "momentsiq_question1_type": "checkbox",  "momentsiq_question1": "What is your favorite color?",  "momentsiq_answer1": "Blue|Purple"}

This is the event for an experience that the visitor closed before answering or submitting:

{  "tealium_event" : "momentsiq_close",  "momentsiq_id"  : "56"}

For a basic example of a Moments iQ experience, see Moments iQ example.

items.title: Manage Moments iQ experiences
items.body:
Moments iQ is in Early Access and is only available to select customers. If you are interested in trying this feature, contact your Tealium Support representative.

To create a Moments iQ experience, navigate to the Tag Marketplace, search for Moments iQ and click + Add. For more information, see About tags.

Position and placement

Configure the following settings to control where the experience appears on a page and how the experience behaves:

  • Experience Type: The type of experience to create.

    • Modal: The experience will appear as a popup window.
    • Embedded: The experience will appear embedded in the page.

  • Suppress Experience: Experiences can be automatically suppressed for returning visitors under the following conditions:

    • Never
    • After close button selected
    • After answer submitted
    • After answer submitted or close button selected

    The browser stores this information in local storage as the momentsiq_suppress key.

  • Experience Placement: The location of a modal window. This is only used with the Modal placement option.

  • Placement Selector: A CSS selector to identify the page element to place the experience. This is used only with the Embedded placement option. For more information about how to determine an element’s selector, see How to Determine the CSS Selector of an Element.

  • Experience Position: The position of the inserted element relative to the element in Placement Selector.

    • Before Begin: Before the page element.
    • After Begin: Just inside the page element, before its first child.
    • Before End: Just inside the page element, after its last child.
    • After End: After the page element.

  • Redirect URL: The URL to redirect the visitor to when the primary button is clicked. Leave this field empty if you do not want to redirect the URL. For example, this can redirect to a thank you page that offers a special offer or a page that contains another experience to ask a follow-up question.

  • Redirect Opens Tab: Select True to open a new tab when the visitor is redirected. This option is available only if you enter a value for Redirect URL.

Experience text

Configure the text that appears on the experience with the following settings:

  • Header Text: The text that appears at the top of the experience.
  • Main Text: The text that appears under the header text.
  • Question Text: The question to ask your visitors.

Experience background image

Complete the following steps to add a background image to the experience:

  1. Under Image Placement, select whether the image will align with the left or the right of the experience window.
  2. Under Image URL, enter a link to an https-secured, externally-hosted image. Suggested image size: 500px by 400px. The file must have a .png, .jpg, .gif, or .svg file extension.

Question and answers

Moments iQ provides multiple question formats that allow you to customize the questions that will guide the visitor to the right experience on your site.

Configure the question and answers with the following settings:

  • Answer Type: The input type for the answer.
    • Radio: The visitor can select only a single answer from the displayed list.
    • Text: The visitor can enter their answer in a single line text box.
    • Checkbox: The visitor can select one or more checkboxes with a label.
  • Answers: The answers to the question:
    • Radio: The answers to display next to each radio button as a JSON array.
      Example: ["Red", "Green", "Yellow", "Teal"]
    • Text: The placeholder text for the text box.
      Example: ["What is your favorite color?"]
    • Checkbox: The answers to display next to each checkbox as a JSON array.
      Example: ["Red", "Green", "Yellow", "Teal"]
  • Primary Button Text: The text label for the primary button. The default value is Submit.

Experience appearance

Configure the experience to match the appearance of your site by entering values from your site’s style sheet for the following appearance properties:

ParameterDescriptionExample
Main Text ColorThe color of the main text, as a hex code or standard color name. The default value is #0A1B36.#1B1B1B
Question Text ColorThe color or the question text, as a hex code or standard color name.#1B1B1B
Answer Text ColorThe color of the answer text, as a hex code or standard color name.#1B1B1B
Primary Button Text ColorThe color of the primary button text, as a hex code or standard color name. The default value is #FFFFFF.#1B1B1B
Header Text Font FamilyThe font family of the header text. The default value is Arial.Arial
Main Text Font FamilyThe font family of the main text. The default value is Arial.Arial
Question Text Font FamilyThe font family of the question text.Arial
Answer Text Font FamilyThe font family of the question text.Arial
Primary Button Font FamilyThe font family of the primary button. The default value is Arial.Arial
Header Text Font SizeThe font size of the header text. The default value is 16px.14px
Main Text Font SizeThe font size of the main text. The default value is 14px.14px
Question Text Font SizeThe font size of the question text.14px
Answer Text Font SizeThe font size of the answer text.14px
Primary Button Text Font SizeThe primary button text size. The default value is 16px.16px
Header Text Font StyleThe font style of the header text. The default value is normal.normal
Main Text Font StyleThe font style of the main text. The default value is normal.normal
Question Text Font StyleThe font style of the question text.normal
Answer Text Font StyleThe font style of the answer text.normal
Primary Button Text Font StyleThe font style of the primary button. The default value is normal.normal
Header Text Font WeightThe font weight of the header. The default value is 700.normal
Main Text Font WeightThe font weight of the main text. The default value is 400.normal
Question Text Font WeightThe font weight of the question text.normal
Answer Text Font WeightThe font weight of the answer text.normal
Primary Button Text Font WeightThe font weight of the primary button text. The default value is 400.400
Outer Container Background ColorThe background color of the experience, as a hex code or standard color name. The default value is #FCFCFC.#1B1B1B
Primary Button Background ColorThe background color of the primary button. The default value is #1B1B1B.#1B1B1B
Outer Container MarginThe margin size of the outermost container. The default value is 0. For more information about margin settings, see MDN Web Docs: margin.1px
Question Container MarginThe margin size of the question’s container. The default value is 0.0
Answer Container MarginThe margin size of the question’s container. The default value is 0.0
Question Container Text AlignThe alignment direction of the question text in its container. The default value is start.start
Answer Container Text AlignThe alignment direction of the answer text in its container. The default value is start.start
Answer Container Flex DirectionThe alignment direction of the answers, either vertically as a column or horizontally as a row. The default value is column.column
Outer Container Border StyleThe border style of the outermost container of the experience. The default value is none.none
Outer Container Border ColorThe color of the border around the outermost container of the experience, as a hex code or standard color name. You must set a border style to a value other than none for the border color to appear. The radius is 8px.8px
Outer Container WidthThe width of the outermost container. The default value is 500px.500px
Z-IndexUse to override the z-order positioning of the experience on the page. Higher values stack on top of lower values.auto

Load rules

Load the experience on all pages or set conditions for when your experience will appear. For more information about load rules and events, see Load Rules and Events.

Data mappings

Mapping is the process of sending data from a data layer variable to the corresponding destination variable of the vendor tag. For more information, see About data mappings.

The available categories are:

Basic Parameters

VariableDescription
Experience Type typeString
Experience Placement placementString
Placement Selector selectorString
Experience Position positionString
Redirect URL redirect_urlString
Redirect Opens Tab redirect_open_tabString
Z-index zindexString
Header Text headerTextString
Main Text mainTextString
Question Text questionTextString
Answer Type answerTypeString
Answers answersArray
Primary Button Text primaryTextString

Text Formatting Parameters

VariableDescription
Header Text Color headerTitle.colorString
Header Text Font Family headerTitle.fontFamilyString
Header Text Font Size headerTitle.fontSizeString
Header Text Font Style headerTitle.fontStyleString
Header Font Weight headerTitle.fontWeightString
Main Text Color mainBodyText.colorString
Main Text Font Family mainBodyText.fontFamilyString
Main Text Font Size mainBodyText.fontSizeString
Main Text Font Style mainBodyText.fontStyleString
Main Text Font Weight mainBodyText.fontWeightString
Question Text Color questionContainer.colorString
Question Text Font Family questionContainer.fontFamilyString
Question Text Font Size questionContainer.fontSizeString
Question Text Font Style questionContainer.fontStyleString
Question Font Weight questionContainer.fontWeightString
Answer Text Color answerContainer.colorString
Answer Text Font Family answerContainer.fontFamilyString
Answer Text Font Size answerContainer.fontSizeString
Answer Text Font Style answerContainer.fontStyleString
Answer Font Weight answerContainer.fontWeightString
Primary Button Text Color primaryButton.colorString
Primary Button Font Family primaryButton.fontFamilyString
Primary Button Text Font Size primaryButton.fontSizeString
Primary Button Font Style primaryButton.fontStyleString
Primary Button Font Weight primaryButton.fontWeightString

Container Formatting Parameters

VariableDescription
Outer Container Background Color outerContainer.backgroundString
Outer Container Margin outerContainer.marginString
Outer Container Border Style outerContainer.borderStyleString
Outer Container Border Color outerContainer.borderColorString
Outer Container Border Radius outerContainer.borderRadiusString
Outer Container Width outerContainer.widthString
Question Container Margin questionContainer.marginString
Question Container Text Align questionContainer.textAlignString
Answer Container Margin answerContainer.marginString
Answer Container Text Align answerContainer.textAlignString
Primary Button Background Color primaryButton.backgroundString
Primary Button Border Radius primaryButton.borderRadiusString
Radio Answer Container Align Items radioContainer.alignItemsString
Radio Answer Container Flex Direction radioContainer.flexDirectionString
Checkbox Answer Container Align Items checkboxContainer.alignItemsString
Checkbox Answer Container Flex Direction checkboxContainer.flexDirectionString
Text Field Answer Container Align Items textFieldContainer.alignItemsString
Text Field Answer Container Flex Direction textFieldContainer.flexDirectionString
Footer Container Align Items textFieldContainer.alignItemsString

Data layer variables

Add the following variables to the data layer using Bulk Import From CSV:

momentsiq_id, UDO Variablemomentsiq_question1, UDO Variablemomentsiq_question1_type, UDO Variablemomentsiq_answer1, UDO Variable

For more information about adding data layer variables in bulk, see Manage variables.

Client-side data persistence

To personalize the visitor experience using the visitor responses to Moments iQ experiences, you need to store the visitor’s responses in local or session storage, depending on the application and use case.

In the following example, we store the answer in local storage using the variable momentsiq_id to specify a dynamic key moments_answer_51, where 51 is the UID of the Moments iQ tag:

localStorage.setItem('moments_answer_' + b['momentsiq_id'], b['momentsiq_answer1']);

The resulting key/value in local storage might look like this:

If you need to retrieve the value that has been stored:

localStorage.getItem('moments_answer_' + b['momentsiq_id']);

For more information, see Local and session storage and Advanced JavaScript Code Extension.

Server-side integration

If you plan to integrate Moments iQ with server-side products such as AudienceStream or EventStream, you will need to collect the data through the Tealium Collect tag and link Tealium iQ to an AudienceStream profile with data layer enrichment.

To enrich server-side attributes, create a rule to ensures that momentsiq_answer1 contains an answer and that momentsiq_id matches the UID of the experience you created.

Example:

Set example_attribute to momentsiq_answer1WHEN Any eventIF `Experience 51 Answered` tealium_event equals momentsiq_submit AND momentsiq_id equals 51

For more information, see About data layer enrichment and Tealium Collect tag.

Save and publish

To test and release your experience, follow the same workflow for other tags. For more information, see About tags.

items.title: Moments iQ Expertise example
items.body:
In the following example, we will embed an experience on an electronics site to ask the visitor what their level of expertise is. This will help you determine the level of comfort the visitor has with product line, which you might use for suggested additional services and products such as home installation services or additional accessories like speaker cable or extended warranties.

Requirements

This example requires the following:

  • Moments iQ.

Step 1: Create data layer variables

Add the following Moments iQ variables to the data layer using Bulk Import From CSV:

momentsiq_question1, UDO Variablemomentsiq_question1_type, UDO Variablemomentsid_id, UDO Variablemomentsiq_answer1, UDO Variable

For more information about adding data layer variables in bulk, see Manage variables.

Step 2: Create tag

The following experience will appear on a category page.

Create a Moments iQ experience for the first engagement with the visitor by adding a Tealium Moments iQ tag with the following properties:

  • Title: Visitor expertise
  • Experience Placement: Center
  • Experience Type: Embedded
  • Experience Position: After Begin
  • Redirect Opens Tab: False
  • Header Text: Expertise
  • Main Text: Help us to get to know you
  • Question Text: What is your experience level with home theater equipment?
  • Answer Type: Radio button
  • Answers: ["Professional","Advanced","Basic","None"]

Under Placement Selector, enter the CSS property where you want the experience to load (for example, div.col-main).

Create load rule

To load the experience only on the home page, create the Home Page load rule with the following properties:

  • Variable: js.page_type
  • Operator: equals (ignore case)
  • Value: home

Step 3: Store the answer

To personalize the visitor experience using the visitor responses to Moments iQ experiences, you need to store the visitor’s responses in local or session storage, depending on the application and use case.

To accomplish this, use a JavaScript Code extension to store the answer in local storage using the variable momentsiq_id (the UID of the Moments iQ tag) to specify a dynamic key.

localStorage.setItem('moments_answer_' + b['momentsiq_id'], b['momentsiq_answer1']);

Be sure to add a condition to the extension so that it only runs when the momentsiq_submit event occurs:

The resulting key/value in local storage will look like this:

If you need to retrieve the value that has been stored:

var answer = localStorage.getItem('moments_answer_' + b['momentsiq_id']);

For more information, see Local and session storage and Advanced JavaScript Code Extension.

Results

When the visitor loads the home page, the home page will embed the experience after the beginning of the div.col-main element.

items.title: Moments iQ Expertise with AudienceStream example
items.body:
In the following example, we will embed an experience on an electronics site to ask the visitor what their level of expertise is. Then, we will enrich the visitor profile with this information. This will help you determine the level of comfort the visitor has with product line, which you might use for suggested additional services and products such as home installation services, speaker cables, or extended warranties.

Requirements

This example requires the following:

  • Moments iQ.
  • Tealium AudienceStream.
  • Data Layer Enrichment enabled.
  • The most recent version of the Tealium Collect tag.

Step 1: Create data layer variables

Add the following Moments iQ variables to the data layer using Bulk Import From CSV:

momentsiq_question1, UDO Variablemomentsiq_question1_type, UDO Variablemomentsid_id, UDO Variablemomentsiq_answer1, UDO Variable

For more information about adding data layer variables in bulk, see Manage variables.

Step 2: Create tag

The following experience will appear on a category page.

Create a Moments iQ experience for the first engagement with the visitor by adding a Tealium Moments iQ tag with the following properties:

  • Title: Visitor expertise
  • Experience Placement: Center
  • Experience Type: Embedded
  • Experience Position: After Begin
  • Redirect Opens Tab: False
  • Header Text: Expertise
  • Main Text: Help us to get to know you
  • Question Text: What is your experience level with home theater equipment?
  • Answer Type: Radio button
  • Answers: ["Professional","Advanced","Basic","None"]

Under Placement Selector, enter the CSS property where you want the experience to load (for example, div.col-main).

Create load rule

To load the experience only on the home page, create the Home Page load rule with the following properties:

  • Variable: js.page_type
  • Operator: equals (ignore case)
  • Value: home

For the purposes of this example, let’s assume that the tag UID is 123.

Step 4: Create AudienceStream attributes

To configure AudienceStream to enrich attributes with the values from the experiences, use the following steps:

  1. If they do not exist already, create the following attributes:
    • Customer_Expertise as a string visit attribute that has a rule that stores the value of momentsiq_answer1.
  2. If they do not exist already, create the following badges:
    • Beginner which checks if the value of the Customer_Expertise visit attribute is None.
    • Basic which checks if the value of the Customer_Expertise visit attribute is Basic.
    • Advanced which checks if the value of the Customer_Expertise visit attribute is Advanced.
    • Professional which checks if the value of the Customer_Expertise visit attribute is Professional.

Because you will eventually create multiple experiences or sets of experiences, you need to ensure that the tealium_event values from experiences only enrich the attributes they are meant to. Update the rules for the attributes to check if the tealium_event values are coming from the appropriate experiences.

For this example, update the rule for the Customer_Expertise visit attribute to check if momentsiq_id matches the UID of the experience you created. This will ensure that only the experience in this example will enrich the Customer_Expertise attribute.

Set Customer_Expertise to momentsiq_answer1WHEN Any eventIF "Expertise Level Answered"  tealium_event equals momentsiq_submit  AND  momentsiq_id equals 123

Results

When the visitor loads the home page, the home page will embed the experience after the beginning of the div.col-main property.

When the customer answers the question, the answer will be stored in their visitor profile and they will be assigned a badge based on their answer.
